Markdown is a lightweight markup language with a plain-text-based syntax designed with the following goals:

* Make it easy to write using a plain text editor
* Make it easy to read and write documents
* Make it easy to convert to HTML

Markdown is a very simple language and is easy to learn. It is also very flexible and can be used to create a wide variety of documents.

Here are some of the basic Markdown syntax:

* **Headings:** Headings are created by using hash marks (#) before the text. The number of hash marks indicates the level of the heading. For example, a level 1 heading is created by using one hash mark (#), a level 2 heading is created by using two hash marks (##), and so on.
* **Text:** Text is simply written as is.
* **Emphasis:** Emphasis can be added to text by using asterisks (*) or underscores (_).
* **Lists:** Lists can be created by using either numbers or dashes.
* **Links:** Links can be created by using the syntax `[link text](link URL)`.
* **Images:** Images can be inserted by using the syntax `[image alt text](image URL)`.

```
* Hello
```

```
# Hello
```
